image.altText: An Indigenous man wearing a cap, watch and black singlet looks up at a camera while seated outdoors.

props.synopsis: Brenton Shar walked away from his father's house one dark night and never came home. His family is still searching for answers, as a senator calls for a federal investigation into missing Indigenous men in Australia.Â

title.children: On a dark night, Brenton left his dad's home and was never seen again

image.altText: Russian President Vladimir Putin

props.synopsis: The Kremlin says the ceasefire will last from 6pm Moscow time on Saturday to midnight at the close of Easter Sunday.

title.children: Putin announces 'Easter truce' in Ukraine until end of Sunday

image.altText: Fresh vegetables on three black shelves with price stickers in front of the items.

props.synopsis: Vote Compass data shows cost of living is the most important issue for respondents ahead of the federal election.

title.children: Cost of living most important issue this election, Vote Compass data shows

image.altText: Clive Palmer National Press Club

props.synopsis: Dominant parties imply the choice is a narrow binary but in reality Australian contests are increasingly determined by third party campaigns.

title.children: Minor parties play a major role this election

image.altText: Powerlines suspended between towers against orange dusk  sky.

props.synopsis: Nuclear? Renewables? Gas? Coal? And what about emissions targets? What the two major parties are offering on energy at this election.

title.children: Your guide to the energy divide at the federal election

image.altText: A young woman and man holding a newspaper together

props.synopsis: Two student reporters scramble to cover Harvardâs funding freeze amid escalating tensions with Donald Trump.Â

title.children: Teen journalists at the centre of the fight between Trump and Harvard

image.altText: Search helicopter 190425

props.synopsis: Australia is continuing to see a deadly start to the Easter long weekend, with five drowning deaths and two people missing after being swept into waters along the east coast.

title.children: Five drowning deaths, two missing as deadly Easter long weekend continues

image.altText: An illustration of a shopping trolley

props.synopsis: The cost of living has dominated politics for three years, and will be top of mind when voters turn up to the ballot box. But how much blame should the federal government really wear?Â

title.children: A supermarket catalogue from 2021 tells us plenty about this election

image.altText: Oscar Jenkins charged

props.synopsis: Russian authorities have laid criminal charges against Australian man Oscar Jenkins for being a "mercenary in an armed conflict", four months after the former teacher was captured while fighting for Ukrainian forces.

title.children: Captured Australian fighter Oscar Jenkins facing 15 years in Russian jail

image.altText: A man seen praying through a window

props.synopsis: Lawyers for the American Civil Liberties Union had filed urgent requests in multiple courts, after reports some men had already been loaded onto buses and were told they were to be deported.

title.children: US Supreme Court halts deportation of Venezuelans in immigration custody

props.synopsis: The strikes come as Israeli troops vow to ramp up attacks in an effort to put pressure on Hamas to release its hostages.Â

title.children: Israeli strikes on Gaza kill more than 90 people in 48 hours

image.altText: A young girl peers from a brown torn curtain.

props.synopsis: Pakistan has expelled more than 80,000 Afghan nationals since the end of March, a senior official said, as part of a renewed crackdown targeting foreigners the government deems to be residing 'illegally' in the country.

title.children: Pakistan drives out 80,000 Afghans in repatriation campaign

image.altText: A generic graphic of a man looking up at a graph that is climbing up, against a background of a house.

props.synopsis: Many young people have written to the ABC with a similar story: they feel like they did everything "right" but will never achieve what previous generations did. It's a story that defined the past week in politics.Â

title.children: Feeling 'cheated' and 'screwed', young voters are shaping the election

image.altText: Three rugby league players in pink celebrate a try.

props.synopsis: Nathan Cleary becomes the Panthers' greatest point-scorer as his side makes a spectacular return to form in a statement win over the Roosters.

title.children: 'The premiers are back': Dominant Panthers exact revenge on Roosters

image.altText: Tameka Yallop playing for the Roar against the Victory.

props.synopsis: Matildas midfielder Tameka Yallop suffers a hamstring injury as the Brisbane Roar lose 2-0 to Melbourne Victory in their final match of the A-League Women season.

title.children: Hamstrung Yallop adds to Matildas' injury woes

image.altText: GettyImages-2210980534

props.synopsis: Melbourne got their first win of the season with an upset over Fremantle, while Richmond beat the previously undefeated Gold Coast. Adelaide put themselves back on the winner's list by scrapping a win against an inaccurate GWS.

title.children: Tigers stun previously undefeated Suns in thriller finish at Marvel Stadium

image.altText: A robot racing in a marathon

props.synopsis: The robots came in all different shapes and sizes. One looked almost human, with feminine features and the ability to wink and smile.

title.children: More than 20 robots race alongside humans at half marathon in Beijing

image.altText: A lady yells at IDF officials while surrounded by the families of those killed on October 7.

props.synopsis: The Israel Defense Forces have received a fiery response from families of victims, who argue an inquiry into the October 7 attacks provides them with little clarity on how their loved ones were killed.

title.children: Leaked video shows families unleashing on IDF in closed hearing

image.altText: Police car and police tape outside a house

props.synopsis: An eight-year-old boy remains in an induced coma after the body of a woman, believed to be his mother, was found in a burnt-out car in Sydney's south-west.

title.children: Boy remains in coma after woman's body found in burnt-out car

image.altText: Three wasps nibbling on a piece of bacon.

props.synopsis: European wasps are swarming regional Victoria, forcing businesses to close and residents to stay indoors, as unusually warm weather causes their numbers to spike.

title.children: Cafes shut, children hide indoors as European wasps terrorise Victoria

image.altText: A redheaded man with a cropped beard walks past a brick-walled building

props.synopsis: After a closed court session in London, Prince Harry declared that his "worst fears" about his security situation have been confirmed. And while he won't discuss details, his relationship with King Charles has hit its lowest point.Â

title.children: 'People would be shocked': Harry says he's shaken by secret evidence

image.altText: Reflection in museum

props.synopsis: Jack joined a social media group to find peer connection. But when he suggested posters could be "a bit misogynistic" the harassment started.

title.children: Blokes Advice aims to end male suicide. One ex-member say it's part of the problem

image.altText: Crowd of young people at Byron Bay's Beach hotel

props.synopsis: Byron Bay CBD venues and businesses will have less event red tape, extended trading hours and protection from noise complaints under a NSW government trial.

title.children: Byron Bay to trial relaxed rules to boost 'waning' nightlife

image.altText: Waves break close to a beach with bush on the edge of the cliffs.

props.synopsis: Organisers were hoping for better surfing conditions after competition was suspended after one heat in the men's opening round on Friday.

title.children: Surfing called off at Bells Beach due to unfavourable conditions

image.altText: woman sitting on couch sipping cup of coffee

props.synopsis: The Let Them Theory from motivational speaker and author Mel Robbins is about letting go of the need to control others and instead focusing on your reactions. We asked three psychologists what they make of it.

title.children: What psychologists think of the Let Them Theory

image.altText: A photo of a grey overcast sky over mangroves and water.

props.synopsis: Emergency services say they will continue to monitor ex-cyclone Errol as it moves through the Kimberley, bringing welcome rain ahead of the busy tourist season.

title.children: Ex-cyclone Errol 'a dodged bullet' as it crosses Kimberley as tropical low

image.altText: A man with a blue apron stands in a room full of packaged chocolate

props.synopsis: Small businesses working over the busy Easter period are counting the cost of rising prices, global economic uncertainty and customers who are becoming more frugal.

title.children: Small businesses feel the pinch amid busy Easter period

image.altText: A woman, smiling, in a green shirt, in her kitchen, holding eggs painted red for Easter

props.synopsis: Usually Catholic and Protestant Easter falls a couple of weeks before Eastern Orthodox Easter, but this year all Christians will be celebrating at the same time.

title.children: Rare calendar alignment sees all Christians celebrate Easter together

image.altText: A man with long blonde hair speaks to someone out of frame

props.synopsis: The winner at the polls on May 3 will face not just a game of global economic and geo-strategic chess, but possibly an epoch-defining choice for the country.

title.children: Whoever is PM after the election will have a big geopolitical choice to make

image.altText: Bulldogs NRL players embrace as they celebrate a try.

props.synopsis: Bulldogs coach Cameron Ciraldo is employing unconventional methods to keep his side motivated as they enjoy their best start to a season in 87 years.

title.children: How a coffee cart is driving Bulldogs' unbeaten start to NRL season

image.altText: Two men sitting at a table with one reaching out a hand to the other

props.synopsis: US President Donald Trump has hit back at Democrat Senator Chris Van Hollen for meeting with Kilmar Abrego Garcia and insists he will not facilitate Garcia's return from El Salvador, despite the US Supreme Court directing him to.

title.children: Trump calls US senator 'fake' for El Salvador visit to man deported in error

image.altText: Gout Gout waves with his left hand after winning his Stawell gift heat.

props.synopsis: Rising sprint stars Gout Gout and Lachlan Kennedy comfortably qualify for the Stawell Gift semifinals to be held on Easter Monday.

title.children: Gout and Kennedy storm into Stawell Gift semis

image.altText: Landscape showing Federation Peak

props.synopsis: A bushwalker who become separated from his walking partner while attempting a challenging hike in Tasmania's remote south-west has been found, police say.

title.children: Bushwalker found after day-long ordeal in Tasmania's south-west wilderness

image.altText: Close up of a feral cat with piercing green eyes looking through green leaves

props.synopsis: Cats pose a real threat to native animals in Australia, but finding a one-size-fits-all approach is proving tricky.

title.children: Cherished companions, or cunning predators? Australia's debate over cats

image.altText: An elderly woman smiles as she sits in her kitchen with a cup of coffee.

props.synopsis: Mavis Rowles reveals her secret to living well as she celebrates turning 101 while still living independently in the town she has called home for more than 90 years.Â

title.children: As Mavis turns 101, she recalls the heartaches and joys of a long life
